page.title: 11The Cornish Language
page.content: At one time Cornwall had a language that was completely different to English.Nowadays very few people can speak it although it is becoming increasingly popular at night school.Although it is not a living language lots of names of Cornish towns and villages are still distinctly Cornish such as Portscatho which means "a harbour for small ships" or Merthyr,"a martyr's chapel".The town of Truro is in fact a slightly changed version of its old Cornish name"Tri-eru" meaning three rivers,the three being the Allen,Kenwyn and Truro.Three of the most common old Cornish words used nowadays occur in the poem which starts"By Tre,Pol and Pen Ye shall know Cornishmen"
